newsitem.title: USA: FP&L sees Turkey Pt 4 restart late Wed..
newsitem.headline: FP&L sees Turkey Pt 4 restart late Wed..

text.p: Florida Power & Light Co (FP&L) confirmed Tuesday it expects to restart its 666 megawatt (MW) Turkey Point 4 nuclear power unit late Wednesday after shutting it Monday for repairs.

"Late Wednesday is the expected time. The repairs are being worked on today," said a FP&L spokesman, confirming an estimated restart date reported earlier Tuesday by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.
The neighboring Turkey Point 3 unit, also 666 MW, was producing electricity at full output, he added.
FP&L is the operator and owner of both Turkey Point nuclear units in Florida City, Fla.
